column4: Hey guys, all my attempts at dual-booting Kubuntu and my existing installation of Windows 7 are failing. Can somebody give me some very basic, step-by-step information?

Actually, ideally, I don't even want to use Windows 7. I just want to get Kubuntu working on my hard drive without losing my many gigs of files. I've been reading for the last two days and trying all sorts of stuff
I don't have an option to boot Kubuntu at system startup. It just boots Windows
did you install grub to your boot sector?
did kubuntu ask if you wanted to install grub? Did you say no?
no. I couldn't even figure out if I wanted it, due to so little information being given about it
Grub is the boot loader. It chooses which OS to boot.
I will warn you that backups of important data is a good thing :-)
we are not responsible for any lost data.
yep. Have nothing to back up to, and can't afford anything
my definition of backup is my free dropbox account.
anything I could not stand loosing is there :-P
I used to use a dropbox. I need 360 GB of space though
